name: Bl. Anna Maria Taigi
summary: Anna Maria Taigi was an Italian laywoman and mystic who lived in Rome. Despite being married and raising seven children, she led a life of deep prayer and mysticism. She received visions and had the gift of prophecy, predicting future events including the French Revolution's effects on Rome. She was known for her charity to the poor and her dedication to the Trinitarian order. She was beatified by Pope Benedict XV in 1920.
